message: Feel free to introduce something your working on here. (startup, project, app, idea)

Excellent idea. I've been working on a community website for Houston, Texas. I have a whole bunch of things going on. I mainly use RSS which keeps the site content fresh and people coming back. Currently I have close on 60 members with more coming on every day.
Sounds great.  What is your website url?

Hey folks, just wanted to make you aware of http://startupwindow.com. It's a service recently launched at SxSWi and it seems to be getting good traction. The service currently allows you to post job opportunities for free. The interesting part is that it allows for a wide range roles and job types. For example you can look for co-founders or an office temp. Looks like the only requirement is that the poster be from or founding a startup. There are also some interesting interviews from leaders/startups in the industry.

@lokeshsah7 your idea is very similar to The Point from Groupon.  First i think you'll need to create a list things you want to change, write/blog about them and let people vote good/bad on them.  Try to add a email newsletter/rss in your website so your serious followers can join you on your journey to changing the world.  I think you should focus on one specific topic that you're devote to.  Research about it and write good information about it for your followers.
@lokeshsah7 http://www.thepoint.com

http://wickedstart.com is an online startup incubator platform to help entrepreneurs start their companies. It is the only free online resource that’s customized for the user’s business idea. We provide a personalized startup checklist of action items at each step of the startup process. We provide access to experts and peers in a community to get their questions answered. We've gathered and vetted resources to plan, structure, fund and market a new business. Doesn't have to be a tech biz either - we're working with mom and pops, services and product companies. Love your feedback.

I have a small live chat app that kicks off this Sunday for F1 fans. 
Check out http://www.LiveF1Chat.com (though for the USA the Australian start time will suck).

You can chat with your friends live during the race, build buddy lists, post to both your twitter and facebook account from within the app, collect badges compete for King of the site etc.

We also have some other sites if not into F1 etc but would be great to see some convore buddy's on the site this Sunday.

Camera 360 is a kind of photo software with powerful functions, which is designed specially for cell-phone. It can provide nearly 30 differences of shooting effect for users selection. By now, it is mainly composed of 6 shooting modes: Effect Mode, Scenery Mode, Funny Mode, Tilt-shift Mode, Color-shift Mode and Normal Mode. You can select different effects within a mode, and can also set the related parameters the achieve the effect which you need. In addition, you can share your photos with your friends by network.  URL: http://blogen.52photo.com/

Hey all - love this group!   Just launched my startup, Meeteor.com, at Wharton last week, but would love the tech community's feedback on it - looking to expand our feature set!  

One Sentence Pitch:   Meeteor is a service that leverages data from Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter to introduce you to people you don't know, but should.  

Thanks!

Hi, I'm the cofounder of Challengein.
Challengein is "The first board game of the location-based era".

In few words, Challengein brings the fun of a match with board games, funny jokes and stupid challenges in your smartphone.
Challengein is an app that one (just one) of your friends will open, when you and your company will arrive into the venue where you'll spend the night.
The group of friends will form two teams who will compete playing mini-board-games, telling jokes and funny facts (proposed) and will do stupid challenges, such as telling a really ugly joke to a waiters, meanwhile your friends are laughing!
Doing so, you'll earn badges to collect and coupons to use.
If your team is the most winning ever in this Venue, you'll conquer it, becoming the King!

Here the official website: http://challengein.com
Use the invitation code "BNMBNM" during the sign up process to get early access.

We just launched Snack&Munch (www.snackandmunch.com) this week!  Making revenue on day one and got slammed with orders the 2nd day.  Had to stay up till 3am fulfilling orders.  We will be the next generation of snacking!  THE ONLINE VENDING MACHINE!
Tasskr http://tasskr.com Simple Task Manager
hi
@ammar, nice!
hi
Just realized the mere mention of snacks gets me writing.

@ammar I like this! I'm not sure about the pricing.  A dollar a snack is a more than I'd pay in my vending machine for snacks.  But I can tell you one way you can beat the machine for sure -- ship only fresh snacks.  I can't tell you how many times I've purchased chocolate bars from a machine or even a convenience store only to find the chocolate had melted and re-solidified, leaving a stale mess.  If you can get enough volume, can you ship king-sized m&ms for a buck?  That would be a way to give a bit more for the money.  Then ship seasonal candy.  Now I'm hungry.  Anyway, good luck!

I just launched iWagerr (www.iwagerr.com), an app that makes tracking and sharing casual bets with friends easy. Use iWagerr to challenge your friends on Twitter on anything and keep track of your win-loss record. My friends and I found it pretty frustrating that there was no easy way to track or share bets we have with one another (e.g. "I bet you that I can down 10 tacos in 20 minutes or I'll pay for dinner next time!" or "If Butler wins UConn, I'll eat my socks."), so iWagerr came about to make this a little easier. Try it out and spread the word!
@AmberGoodenough for clubdivot.com did  you design it? what did you use? and do you use wireframe software at all?

@dabent Thanks for the 2 cents we appreciate it!  We always ship stuff that is fresh.  If you think about it Snack&Munch items are less than $1 each, because we are actually bringing the snacks to you for free.  Also we made the pricing competitive with c-stores and gas stations, most of those places have stuff for more than $1.  The vending machines are ok if you want to eat the same snack all the time, but if you want some variety and don't want to carry change around (like many people) then the Snack&Munch service will work for you well.  Try it out and let me know how your experience goes.  promo code: 2BUCKS
@surajreddy Suraj try my service out and let us know what you think!  promo code: 2BUCKS
oh and also we got written about by NBC http://www.nbcwashington.com/the-scene/food-drink/Online-Vending-Machine-119185494.html, I'm pretty excited about that :-)

We are gearing up to launch BusinessLeads.com - to justify turning down seven figures for the domain we have been building the ultimate tool for people to use to expand their business and monetize their professional networks. http://hubski.com/ Hubski is a community for sharing thoughtful information and conversation. Here you can find interesting stories, ideas and events, and share what interests you with others. We refer to Hubski as a "Decentralized Social aggregator" in that posts don't compete for space on a home page but rather propagate throughout our community by sharing and re-sharing. We've been described as what a child of Reddit and Twitter would look like. -Come check us out!

http://blipme.com/  Blip is a location-based social network that allows you to connect with people nearby in a really cool way.  Simply do a blip search to browse all the people in your vicinity, never miss a meaningful connection again.

http://CrowdPlace.com - CrowdPlace is built to save or share everything in a more structured way so you can find it later.  CrowdPlace is a combination of twitter-like simplicity with delicious-style findability (tags, search, bookmarklet, etc). Another great feature is that you post things (text, links, videos, etc.) into categories - so you customize the categories you care about. Less noise, more findability.
@willmurphy sounds cool

@look_antony thanks! At http://CrowdPlace.com we are scratching our own itch and building something that solves several issues with organization, findability, and noise. Making improvements regularly. Lot's more good features coming.
